drupalNodeEvent.title: China-Latin America and the Caribbean: Infrastructure, Connectivity, and Everyday Life

field_speakers.processed: Ariel C. Armony (University of Pittsburgh), Carol Chan (Universidad Academia de Humanismo Cristiano), Sergio Martínez Rivera (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México), Patricia Palma (Universidad de Tarapacá de Arica)

field_organizers.processed: Asian Studies Center, Center for Latin American Studies (University of Pittsburgh), and the Red Académica de América Latina y el Caribe sobre China (Universidad Nacional Autónoma de México)

field_description.processed: Participants from the United States, China, Brazil, Chile, Ecuador, Mexico, Jamaica, and Peru will analyze China's impact on everyday life in Latin America through an analysis of infrastructure projects and immigration. Day Two will focus on immigration.
